instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A Not power on
threads.message:
hi,
there was a picture on the device, but there was a square on the screen,so i removed the video card, reballing it and plugged it in. but  the fan keeps turning and stopping , it keeps doing the same thing it turns. orj 85 watt apt. no battery 

SCL = 3.421 Voltage fixed
SDA = 3.421 Voltage fixed

Diyot mode
SCL=0.505
SDA=0.504

F7040 = 12.57 Voltage fixed

i tried SMC bypass = the fan spins 1 time at full speed and stops then spins again at normal speed and stops
